<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Focused Fascination](/Feats.aspx?ID=1516) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Swashbuckler" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=321" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 88 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[Fascinating Performance](/Feats.aspx?ID=781)

</column>

---

When you use [Fascinating Performance](/Feats.aspx?ID=781) in a combat encounter, you need only a success, rather than a critical success, to [fascinate](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14) your target. This works only if you're attempting to fascinate one target. For example, if you were an expert in [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12), you could choose to target multiple creatures normally or target one creature and fascinate it on a success.
name: Focused Fascination
